abstract: Given that the North Anna plant in Virginia suffered only cosmetic damage in a quake, nuclear officials say, conclusions drawn from a conventional measure of ground motion may have been somewhat misleading.
snippet: Given that the North Anna plant in Virginia suffered only cosmetic damage in a quake, nuclear officials say, conclusions drawn from a conventional measure of ground motion may have been somewhat misleading.
lead_paragraph: Once the dust had settled after the Aug. 23 earthquake centered in Mineral, Va., the tweet-length description of the problem at the North Anna nuclear plant was that the ground motion was bigger than what the reactors were designed to deal with, which is highly unusual.

headline.main: After a Quake, 2 Yardsticks for Nuclear Inspectors
